g.text: Conceptualization, J.Q.; Data curation, G.L.; Formal analysis, G.L. and D.L.; Funding
acquisition, J.Q. and G.W.; Investigation, X.Z.; Methodology, D.L.; Project administration, J.Q. and P.C.; Resources,
X.L.; Software, G.L., D.L. and S.J.; Writing—original draft, G.L.; Writing—review & editing, J.Q., X.Z. and X.C.
This work was supported by a grant fromthe National Nature Science Foundation of China: “Design of
structure and gelling performance of Montmorillonite
Alkylammonium based on the adsorption properties of
Alkylammoniumon Montmorillonite (No: 51774200)” and “Study on the immobilization e
heavy metal in sulﬁde-mine tailings by chelating agent modiﬁed bentonite” (No: 51764003).
The authors declare no conﬂict of interest.

) in a montmorillonite model. Inﬂuence of isomorphic substitution.

lot, B.; Zajac, J.; Van Damme, H. Di

of montmorillonite in bentonite as a pharmaceutical excipient in drug delivery systems.

basin conditions, application of CLAYFF force ﬁeld in parallel GCMC.

ﬂuorescent dyes over montmorillonite andsaponite modiﬁedby surfactant.

10. Skipper, N.T. Monte carlo simulation of interlayer molecular structure in swelling clay minerals. 2. Monolayer

12. Chang, F.R.C.; Skipper, N.T.; Sposito, G. Computer simulation of interlayer molecular structure in sodium
13. Boek, E.S.; Coveney, P.V.; Skipper, N.T. Monte Carlo molecular modeling studies of hydrated Li-, Na-, and
K-smectites_Understanding the role of potassiumas a clay swelling inhibitor.

ect of layer charge on the crystalline swelling of Na
montmorillonites: DFT and molecular dynamics studies.

Mg-montmorillonites systems, in function of the pressure.
